results.title: Clueless
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin, Robert Lawrence and Amy Heckerling
results.brief_description: Alicia Silverstone plays Cher, the most popular and glamourous girl at Beverly Hills High. Cher is a girl with a mission; she wants to find a love match for her debating teacher so she can improve her grades and a fashion makeover is a must for her dowdy friend. While she tries to organise everyone else’s love life, when it comes to her own she is utterly ‘Clueless.’ Amy Heckerling’s film about designer clad Los Angeles teenagers is an infectious comedy while Silverstone’s performance is delightful.

results.title: Closely observed trains = Ostre sledovane vlaky [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Barrandov Studios, Zdenek Oves and Jiri Menzel
results.brief_description: During the German occupation, a young man, Milos, (Vaclav Neckar) works as a trainee railway guard in a country station. He has only one thing on his mind; to lose his virginity, possibly with the wife of the station master (Libuse Havelkova). His attempts take him through the trauma of premature ejaculation, an attemped suicide and finally success with a member of the Underground movement, before tragedy strikes. “Closely observed trains” is adapted from a novel by Bohumil Hrabal. This film is one of the finest achievements of the Czech “New Wave” and was the second Czech film to win an Oscar for best foreign film in 1967. The film was banned after the Soviet invasion of 1969 as “pornographic”. Also known as “Closely watched trains”. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Close encounters of the third kind [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, EMI/Parlophone, Victor Vasarely, Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: Roy Neary (Richard Dreyfuss) witnesses the arrival of flying saucers from an alien world. Thus begins an incredible series of events, culminating in the ultimate encounter with other worldly beings as Neary is led aboard the awesome mothership. Humans and aliens have made peaceful contact. Spielberg has replaced certain scenes with previously unreleased footage and expanded the dimensions of special effects with a breathtaking new ending that takes the viewer inside the dazzling Mothership and beyond the outer reaches of the imagination. Cast also includes Teri Garr and a special appearance by Francois Truffaut as Lacombe.

results.title: Clockers
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Martin Scorsese, Spike Lee and Jon Kilik
results.brief_description: An evocative and hard-hitting story of a drug run urban battlefield where Strike (Mekhi Phifer), a 24-hour drug dealer known as a ‘clocker’, finds that his time of success on the street is running out. Nursing an ulcer and spending his spare time playing with model trains and hanging around with his brothers outside the project houses, one day Strike is given a tip off by the local drug lord, Rodney, for what seems to be an opportunity for advancement. However, when a rival dealer ends up dead and his own law-abiding brother confesses to the murder he finds himself caught between two homicide detectives, only one of whom is concerned about the truth, and the wrath and cover ups of his street-wise colleagues. This film poignantly explores the complex machinations of a neighbourhood spiraling out of control where few can be credited with looking after anyone but themselves. Layered with issues of social and racial upheaval and prejudice and the evocation of the qualities and disparities of human behaviour this is another example of powerful filmmaking from director, Spike Lee.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones and the casino of gold
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Tennant and Chuck Bail
results.brief_description: Tamara Dobson reprises her role as special agent Cleopatra Jones, a martial arts crime buster, who’s fierce Kung Fu moves are only eclipsed by her outlandish dress sense and heavy eye make up (Dobson is credited as her own make up artist). In her latest adventure Cleopatra finds herself in Hong Kong, taking on the vast drug cartel which is run by the evil and aptly named Dragon Lady (Stella Stevens). Highlights from this blaxploitation action film include Cleopatra’s poor attempts at undercover work, a difficult task for a 6‘2 black woman in Hong Kong, made even more impossible by her outrageous choice of wardrobe and unbelievable head gear. Cast also includes Tanny, Norman Fell, Albert Popwell and Caro Kenyatta.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones
results.creator_credit: William Tennant, Bill Tennant and Jack Starett
results.brief_description: Cleopatra Jones is dedicated to wiping out drug dealers on an international scale, with her personal anger directed at the pushers who operate in the ghettos. One such operator is her arch-nemesis, the black leathered ‘Mommy’. When the drug traffickers’s deadliest and most beautiful enemy oversees the torching of a poppy field in Turkey, she leaves Mommy feeling pretty burned up. Mommy’s revenge is first directed at the ghetto’s anti-drug headquarter and Cleo must take on Mommy and her offbeat stooges Doodlebug, Pickle, Snake and more. Cast includes Tamara Dobson, Bernie Casey, Brenda Sykes, Antonio Fargas, Bill McKinner and Shelley Winters.

results.title: Clear and present danger
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Mace Neufeld, Robert Rehme and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: Tom Clancy created the hero Jack Ryan in a series of thriller espionage novels. Harrison Ford again plays the intrepid CIA agent. When his mentor (James Earl Jones) becomes gravely ill, Ryan is appointed CIA Deputy Director of Intelligence. A tough first assignment awaits when he is asked to investigate the murder of a personal friend of the President with secret ties to Columbian drug cartels. A deadly field operative (Willem Dafoe) has been despatched in a covert operation against the Columbians unbeknown to Ryan. Directed by Australia’s Philip Noyce, this is an action-packed film which looks at corruption in the corridors of power.

results.title: Clash of the titans
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Charles H. Schneer, Ray Harryhausen and Desmond Davis
results.brief_description: Harry Hamlin stars in this film as Perseus, the Greek mythological character, a gifted impetuous youth, sent on a heroic quest. His mission is to fight the deadly creature Kraken, a towering sea monster that is the last of the powerful Titans. If Perseus succeeds he will win the hand of the beautiful Andromeda, an imprisoned princess, and gain the ownership of half the kingdom. Having embarked on his quest, Perseus is aided by Pegasus, the winged horse and Ammon, a benevolent playwright. Laurence Olivier stars as the God Zeus and Maggie Smith as Thetis, a Greek Goddess with magical powers. Ray Harryhausen (who worked on Jason and the Argonauts) utilised his skills and experience to create stop animation for many sequences, which to modern CGI eyes can seem quite dated. Some impressive cinematography is let down by the clunky dialogue and inexpressive face of lead Harry Hamlin but the film is fun and provides a background to the wonderful world of Greek mythology. Conceived in the wake of the phenomenal success of “Star Wars”, “Clash of the titans” did not reach its expected audience who were flooding instead to the thrills of “Raiders of the lost ark”.

results.title: Clash by night
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Harriet Parsons and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: Barbara Stanwyck again plays the femme fatale, with her usual flair, in this adaptation of Clifford Odets’ Broadway play. Mae Doyle returns to Monterey, California, after seeking a life of adventure in the city. Disillusioned and bitter, she forms a relationship with her brother Joe’s friend Jerry (Paul Douglas). A quiet fisherman, Jerry is a decent hardworking husband, but Mae is drawn into an illicit affair with her husband’s friend Earl Pfeiffer (Robert Ryan). Marilyn Monroe makes a brief but memorable appearance as a young girl. “Clash by night” is the age-old story of the “Eternal Triangle” where one woman must choose between two men.
